snippet: Through festivals — not fairs — John Durant, of the M.I.T. Museum, strives to demystify science in an era of divisive issues like climate change, vaccines and embryonic stem cell research.
abstract: MIT Museum director Dr John Durant is leading a successful effort to promote science festivals across the United States; events aim to bring in tourist dollars, introduce people to scientists and demystify science in an era when researchers and large sectors of the public differ on major public policy issues.
lead_paragraph: Through festivals — not fairs — John Durant, of the M.I.T. Museum, strives to demystify science in an era of divisive issues like climate change, vaccines and embryonic stem cell research.
